instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Hi,

Need help with a A820-00165 board. Green light and then goes amber but no fan spin. Came with a short and changed <CAPACITOR>C7375</CAPACITOR> to eliminate the short. Replaced F7140 and i get a green light and then it turns amber but no fan spin. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing in L7520. What next...

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.34v measured on <CAPACITOR>C8130</CAPACITOR> Pin 1
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.34v measured on <RESISTOR>R8133</RESISTOR> Pin 1

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>, at same time.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> at same time.
If detected, try starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Be sure no pulse at all.
Check triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> several times.
If still not detected, there is something wrong on PCH side probably.
Check first if <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> is steady high.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message: No pulse after triggering it several times.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
Check other signals expected by PCH; <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>.
Don't forget its 4 RTC (DC) signals.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - 3.42v measured on <RESISTOR>R1451</RESISTOR> Pin 1
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> - 2.7v measured on <RESISTOR>R1450</RESISTOR> Pin 2
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 0.36mv measured on <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR> Pin 2
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.42v measured on <RESISTOR>R5185</RESISTOR> Pin1
I don't have a scope so this is the best i could do with my multimeter...

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message:
You don't need an o-scope.
I specified to check DC signals.

"<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 0.36mv"
There is the problem.
Using original Magsafe 2 charger?

Just in case, try starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin.
threads.message: Wow... changed the charger and bang... Fan spin and looks like it's solved...... Thank u...
